message: Robert J. Dettling the Constitution IS theirs, yours, and mine. It's not about cows and land. You went to university in California... unconscionable things are going on there too. These men did in fact petition for redress for years but the government ignored them... normally that would result in a default judgement for the plaintiff... but that's in a world where the system is honest. They had no other legal recourse. I'd be happy to talk to you about this if you want, just hit me up on chat.

I found out they fed my newborn a bottle of formula and """"some sugar water"""" right after delivery (had a c-section) even though I asked them to bring the baby to me for feeding, which I was completely able to do although inexperienced. Also, I asked for BF support the second day, but was told the woman was not available that day. Took a few tries but my baby & I finally figured it out on our own. A lot of stress could have been avoided with just a little support.
A scary sample of how powerful a """"lobby"""" can be!!! End Citizens United!!!
Daytona

The history of slavery Joe, is very confusing, but there is no doubt that the traditional enemies in Africa took of advantage of one of the basic laws of capitalism, it's called demand. The demand for manual labor in the """"new"""" world that was being stolen from its rightful owners created this demand and created a huge market for slaves. It is very unlikely that without this demand there would have been much less abductions among Africans for that purpose. The primary criminals, and this is irrefutable, were the Christians with their need for cheap manual labor in America.
